info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Richmond and northwestern Westmoreland Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 115 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Leedstown, or near Colonial Beach. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Colonial Beach around 200 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Lerty, Stratford Hall, Potomac Beach, Potomac Mills, Oak Grove, Singerly, Peeds, Foneswood and Westmoreland State. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
